title: Set Equal to Zero
text: The first step in solving the equation is to move all the terms to one side to be equal to zero.

title: Writing as Quadratic
text: Note that the exponent of the $$e^2 x$$ is $$2x$$, with another $$e^x$$ term term with $$x$$ as the exponent. Substitute $$e^x$$ to another variable, such as $$t$$.

title: Rewriting Equation
text: What is the equation rewritten where $$e^x=t$$?

title: Solving for Variable
text: To solve for the value of the variable, first find two numbers that sum to $$-1$$ and multiply to $$-2$$ and factor.

title: Factored Form
text: What is the factored form of the equation with $$t$$?

title: Zero Product Property
text: For two factors multiplied to be equal to be zero, one or the other must be equal to zero.

title: Setting Factors Equal to Zero
text: To solve, set both factors equal to zero and isolate the variable $$t$$.

title: Reintroducing $$e^x$$
text: To solve the original equation, set $$t$$ back to be equal to $$e^x$$.

title: Inverse Functions
text: Since ln(x) and $$e^x$$ are inverse functions, taking the natural log of a term with e leaves only the exponent left.

title: Extraneous Solutions
text: Remember that the argument of a logarithm is always positive. There may be solutions that are extraneous.
